meanings.definition: To change the natural qualities of a substance
meanings.sent1: The heat will denature the protein in the egg.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how heat can denature proteins in food.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally denatured the fabric by washing it in hot water.
meanings.sent4: The artist denatured the traditional painting style with bold colors.
meanings.sent5: The acid's effect on the metal was so strong, it seemed to denature its very essence.

meanings.definition: To render a protein inactive by altering its structure
meanings.sent1: High temperatures can denature the protein in milk.
meanings.sent2: Enzymes can denature proteins during digestion.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that overcooking the steak would denature the protein into rubber.
meanings.sent4: The intense workout seemed to denature his muscles, leaving him exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The harsh chemicals in the cleaning solution appeared to denature the protein stains on the carpet.

meanings.definition: To make something less natural or pure
meanings.sent1: Adding artificial flavors can denature the taste of the juice.
meanings.sent2: Excessive processing can denature the nutritional value of food.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to denature the laws of physics.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury seemed to denature the peaceful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The factory's smoke seemed to denature the purity of the mountain air.
